District attorneys have escaped oversight for too long. That ends now.
CONTACT YOUR LAWMAKERS

Dear ##SM_RULE_360 Email Salutation##,

We can make history. Our state lawmakers are about to vote on a cutting-edge bill that would create a new level of transparency and accountability for our elected district attorneys. These powerful criminal justice figures have operated in secret for far too long.

Tell your legislator to vote for a more accountable and transparent criminal justice system.

Many Oregon district attorneys have no policies guiding how to prosecute people or carry out the core functions of their office. Why does that matter? Because these policies can make the difference between whether a crime victim gets services, whether a young person has a second chance at life, and whether people are treated fairly in the system, regardless of what they look like or where they live.

And even if DAs have developed these policies, they often put up barriers for the public to see them. So defendants, victims, and community members are left in in the dark about how their elected district attorneys operate.

This is unacceptable. But House Bill 3224 would change all of that. The bill would require DA offices to develop a range of policies. This would bring much-needed consistency to our system, and it would tear down the barriers that DAs use to hide their policies from the public. We would all then have the information to hold elected district attorneys accountable for how they run their offices.

This bill has so much momentum that it has already made it through the first committee and is now headed to the House Floor.

Send a message to your lawmakers that you want transparency and accountability for our criminal justice system.

These changes are critical. The time is right. This bill can pass. But it needs your support. Help us win this reform.

Thanks for sticking with us,

Daniel Lewkow
Campaign Manager, They Report to You, ACLU of Oregon
